name: MatchReady Medical Interview Pack
description: Comprehensive content pack for medical student residency and fellowship interviews with MMI (Multiple Mini Interview) scenarios.

evaluations.title: Clinical Reasoning & Problem Solving
evaluations.description: Assess clinical decision-making and diagnostic reasoning skills.

criteria.name: Clinical Knowledge
criteria.description: Demonstrates appropriate medical knowledge and understanding of clinical concepts.

criteria.name: Reasoning Process
criteria.description: Shows logical, systematic approach to problem-solving and differential diagnosis.

criteria.name: Communication
criteria.description: Clearly articulates thought process and medical reasoning.

criteria.name: Patient Safety
criteria.description: Considers patient safety, risk management, and appropriate escalation.

questions.text: A 55-year-old male presents to the ED with acute chest pain radiating to his left arm. Walk me through your differential diagnosis and initial management approach.
A 2-year-old child presents with fever of 39Â°C for 3 days. The parents are worried. How would you approach this case?
You realize you've made a medication dosing error for a patient. The patient hasn't received the medication yet. What do you do?

evaluations.title: Medical Ethics & Professionalism
evaluations.description: Evaluate ethical reasoning, professional judgment, and handling of complex moral dilemmas.

criteria.name: Ethical Framework
criteria.description: Applies ethical principles (autonomy, beneficence, non-maleficence, justice) appropriately.

criteria.name: Perspective Taking
criteria.description: Considers multiple stakeholder perspectives and competing interests.

criteria.name: Professionalism
criteria.description: Demonstrates professional values, integrity, and appropriate boundaries.

criteria.name: Communication
criteria.description: Articulates reasoning clearly and shows empathy.

questions.text: An elderly patient with early dementia refuses a recommended surgery. The family insists you should proceed. How do you handle this situation?
You suspect a colleague is coming to work impaired. What are your ethical obligations and how would you address this?
You have one ICU bed available and two critically ill patients who need it. How do you make this decision?
A medical error occurred that harmed a patient. You were not directly involved but witnessed it. What is your responsibility?

evaluations.title: Patient Communication & Empathy
evaluations.description: Assess communication skills, empathy, and ability to handle difficult conversations.

criteria.name: Empathy & Compassion
criteria.description: Demonstrates genuine empathy, active listening, and emotional intelligence.

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: Communicates clearly, avoids jargon, checks understanding.

criteria.name: Rapport Building
criteria.description: Establishes trust, shows respect, and creates safe environment.

criteria.name: Handling Difficult Conversations
criteria.description: Manages emotional situations, delivers bad news appropriately.

questions.text: You need to tell a young mother that her child has been diagnosed with leukemia. How would you approach this conversation?
A patient is angry about wait times and is yelling at you in the hallway. How do you respond?
You need to obtain informed consent from a patient who doesn't speak English and no interpreter is immediately available. What do you do?
You're explaining diabetes management to a patient with limited health literacy. How do you ensure they understand?

evaluations.title: Teamwork & Interprofessional Collaboration
evaluations.description: Evaluate ability to work in teams, collaborate with other healthcare professionals, and handle team conflicts.

criteria.name: Collaboration
criteria.description: Works effectively with diverse team members and values interprofessional input.

criteria.name: Leadership
criteria.description: Shows appropriate leadership, delegates effectively, and supports team members.

criteria.name: Conflict Resolution
criteria.description: Handles disagreements constructively and maintains professional relationships.

criteria.name: Team Communication
criteria.description: Communicates clearly with team, provides updates, and seeks input.

questions.text: A nurse questions your medication order. You believe you're correct. How do you handle this?
Two members of your team have a personal conflict that's affecting patient care. As a resident, what do you do?
You receive a patient handoff with incomplete information. The previous team has left. What's your approach?

categories.name: Clinical Knowledge

categories.name: Clinical Reasoning

categories.name: Communication

categories.name: Patient Safety
categories.description: Prioritizes patient safety and appropriate risk management.

categories.name: Ethical Reasoning

categories.name: Perspective Taking

competencies.name: Medical Knowledge
competencies.description: Knowledge about established and evolving biomedical, clinical, and cognate sciences.

competencies.name: Patient Care
competencies.description: Compassionate, appropriate, and effective patient care.

competencies.name: Interpersonal and Communication Skills
competencies.description: Effective information exchange and collaboration with patients, families, and professionals.

competencies.name: Professionalism
competencies.description: Commitment to professional responsibilities and adherence to ethical principles.

competencies.name: Practice-Based Learning and Improvement
competencies.description: Investigation and evaluation of patient care, appraisal of evidence, and improvement.

competencies.name: Systems-Based Practice
competencies.description: Awareness of healthcare system context and ability to optimize care delivery.
